comment: A very different flavor profile for a Balvenie, leaning towards cocoa powder and coffee grounds rather than its trademark honey. Finishes strong and long with more cocoa powder and black Russian bread. These are all tastes I gravitate towards - porters and stouts are my favorite beers - and Balvenie is to be commended for experimenting with barley variations. But I found the nose disappointingly shy.

Pour in online drammers club tasting. Cask 6682, first fill bourbon cask. 


Nose: Orange, Honey, Caramel, Chocolate, Mocha, Cherry, Raisins, Vanilla, Apricot, Coconut, Banana, Flowers, Pepper

Palate: Chocolate, Mocha, Honey, Caramel, Toffee, Vanilla, Pepper, Smoke, Orange, Cherry, Raisins, Flowers

Finish: Pepper, Chocolate, Caramel, Honey, Smoke, Orange, Mint, Flowers, Coffee

The best of the night and that lineup included heavy hitters such as a 1980s balvenie 10 year old founder’s reserve in a cognac bottle, a 1980s Balvenie Classic oldest selection 18 year which is predecessor to the doublewood we know today, this, and a 1971 33 year old vintage cask
